unnormalised: IRCTC announces special summer trains to ease travel rush!
normalised: I-R-C-T-C announces special summer trains to ease travel rush!

unnormalised: Listen up, folks! With the summer heat already bearing down on us, Indian Railways Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has decided to prepone its plans and introduce special summer trains. This is great news especially for those planning to travel back home for vacation or visit family. We all know how packed the trains get during this time of year!
normalised: Listen up, folks! With the summer heat already bearing down on us, Indian Railways Catering and Tourism Corporation (I-R-C-T-C) has decided to prepone its plans and introduce special summer trains. This is great news especially for those planning to travel back home for vacation or visit family. We all know how packed the trains get during this time of year!

unnormalised: The first batch of special trains will start running from 15/04/2024. These trains will primarily cover routes connecting major cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai, and Bangalore to popular vacation destinations and states with high migrant worker populations like Bihar and Uttar Pradesh. Think Patna-Delhi, Mumbai-Gorakhpur, and Howrah-Chennai routes.
normalised: The first batch of special trains will start running from fifteenth april two thousand and twenty four. These trains will primarily cover routes connecting major cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai, and Bangalore to popular vacation destinations and states with high migrant worker populations like Bihar and Uttar Pradesh. Think Patna-Delhi, Mumbai-Gorakhpur, and Howrah-Chennai routes.

unnormalised: According to a railway official, approximately 250 special trains are expected to run this summer season. Each train will have a mix of AC and non-AC coaches. The fares for these trains are expected to be slightly higher than regular trains – maybe around 10-15% more. This is something you might want to consider before booking your tickets.
normalised: According to a railway official, approximately two hundred and fifty special trains are expected to run this summer season. Each train will have a mix of A-C and non-A-C coaches. The fares for these trains are expected to be slightly higher than regular trains – maybe around ten to fifteen percent more. This is something you might want to consider before booking your tickets.

unnormalised: "We're expecting a huge rush this year," says Mr. Rajesh Kumar, spokesperson for Northern Railways. "We’ve already seen a 20% jump in ticket bookings compared to last year for the month of May." So, if you're planning to travel anytime soon, don't delay!
normalised: "We're expecting a huge rush this year," says Mister Rajesh Kumar, spokesperson for Northern Railways. "We’ve already seen a twenty percent jump in ticket bookings compared to last year for the month of May." So, if you're planning to travel anytime soon, don't delay!

unnormalised: Ticket bookings are open on the IRCTC website and app right now. Keep an eye out for more announcements about the train schedules and availability. Remember to check the platform number before boarding – especially at busy stations like New Delhi Rly Stn or CST Mumbai.
normalised: Ticket bookings are open on the I-R-C-T-C website and app right now. Keep an eye out for more announcements about the train schedules and availability. Remember to check the platform number before boarding – especially at busy stations like New Delhi Railway Station or C-S-T Mumbai.

unnormalised: IRCTC also urges passengers to carry sufficient water, especially during peak hours when temperatures can soar above 40°C. Stay hydrated and have a safe journey! They have also asked passengers to report any issues or concerns to the onboard TTE or helpline number 139.
normalised: I-R-C-T-C also urges passengers to carry sufficient water, especially during peak hours when temperatures can soar above forty degree celsius. Stay hydrated and have a safe journey! They have also asked passengers to report any issues or concerns to the onboard T-T-E or helpline number one hundred and thirty nine.

unnormalised: Happy travels, guys! Let's hope this summer, the special trains will help you reach home aaram se! Don't forget to pack your snacks and some good books for the long journey. And maybe some masala chai for the road? ;)
